metadata.title: CVE-2024-57931 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:selinux: ignore unknown extended permissionsWhen evaluating extended permissions, ignore unknown permissions insteadof calling BUG(). This commit ensures that future permissions can beadded without interfering with older kernels.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-57931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.13.0-173.224
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.13.0-173.224
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro
